column4: how do i fix Unknown id: apt-get when i use "su" instead of "sudo"
what exactly are you typing at the command line?
su apt-get update
it does the same thing any time i use "su" in place of "sudo"
try su -c "apt-get update"
su: Authentication failure
even with the right password
do you have the root account enabled?
i used to always use su
sudo is too much to type
and i dont know if i have root account enabled
I note that "sudo" is shorter than "su -c"
it's not enabled by default, so you probably don't.
i always did "su command" in the past
now i do "sudo command"
this is a fresh install of 8.10 and it's like that
considering that "su command" has never been valid syntax, I don't think you did =/
you're calling me a liar
that's how i always used it "su command"
if you're concerned about the length of "sudo", try putting something like "alias s = 'sudo'" in your .bashrc
and yes, since I have man su on my side, I'm saying "su command" doesn't work.
